image.altText: A scientist with a microscope.

props.synopsis: When Queen Elizabeth II used a product on her royal tour of Australia in 1963, journalists noticed. Then everyone wanted to use it.

title.children: The Aussie invention made famous by Queen Elizabeth II

image.altText: A racecar emits purple and blue smoke. It has no bonnet and the engine can be seen on display.

props.synopsis: Australia's largest car festival draws to a close in Canberra, with record cars, championship wins, and a brawl that police are investigating.

title.children: Brawl contained, fireworks cancelled due to fire ban as Summernats ends

image.altText: An aerial view of a lakeside park in the foreground, with a mountain topped by a tower in the background.

props.synopsis: For the first time since the Black Summer bushfires, a total fire ban will be imposed in the ACT. The ban will be in place for the duration of Saturday.

title.children: Total fire ban to begin in the ACT for first time in six years

image.altText: A baby wombat lies in a blanket in a person's arms.

props.synopsis: There are about 40-50 active volunteer carers within ACT Wildlife, but the organisation says more are needed, especially as the temperature soars.

title.children: 'Terrible job having to cuddle baby wombats': Behind the scenes as a wildlife carer

image.altText: Generic NSW Police blue and white tape

props.synopsis: A 25-year-old man has died after a crash between a car and a truck on the Monaro Highway, south of Canberra.

title.children: ACT records first road fatality of 2026 after crash near Royalla

image.altText: Cars drive on a three-lane road bridge with two lanes closed for construction.

props.synopsis: Commuters in Canberra are facing major disruptions as Commonwealth Avenue Bridge undergoes two years of major upgrades.

title.children: Get ready Canberra. Significant disruptions are here

image.altText: A man in a light purple apron and a black t-shirt stirs sliced onions in a saucepan on a stovetop.

props.synopsis: If you're a food lover, chances are you've heard of the Michelin Guide – you may have even dined at a Michelin-starred restaurant, but not here in Australia.

title.children: Why there are no Michelin-starred restaurants in Australia

image.altText: More than two-thousand people attended a vigil for the Bondi shooting victims,

props.synopsis: More than 2,000 people attended a vigil for the Bondi shooting victim at the Bondi Pavilion, marking the end of the Jewish period of mourning.

title.children: Waltzing Matilda tribute for youngest victim of the Bondi shooting

image.altText: Protesters gather as vehicles burn, amid evolving anti-government unrest

props.synopsis: The US-based Human Rights Activists News Agency says a further 10,600 people have been arrested as Iran's theocratic government attempts to crack down on the demonstrations.

title.children: At least 500 killed in Iran protests as Trump weighs up intervention

image.altText: Image of strips of paper scrunched into the shape of a brain. The paper says words like "stress" and "anxiety".

props.synopsis: Everyone experiences intrusive thoughts, and most people can brush them off without a worry. But what happens when those intrusive thoughts become inescapable?

title.children: Can't shake intrusive thoughts? It might be a sign of OCD

image.altText: Two white Wegovy prescription medicine boxes seen on a turquoise surface.

props.synopsis: The cost of weight loss drug Wegovy will soon be massively subsidised for Australians with severe obesity who have had a stroke or heart attack.

title.children: Ozempic-like drug to be listed on PBS for people with severe obesity

image.altText: A main street with two graphics of a KFC sign and a McDonald's sign on either side of the image.

props.synopsis: Nutrition, vibe and culture concerns fuel these communities who want to protect their suburb's identity and businesses from the fast food giants.

title.children: 'We can't survive it': The suburbs fighting against fast food giants

image.altText: A pole with a large camera elevated above a bushland area in rural Tasmania.

props.synopsis: As fire crews were responding to two fires on Tasmania's east coast in December, an AI camera nestled in a nearby vantage point spotted a third blaze. The early detection meant the fire was extinguished just two hours later.

title.children: Tasmania to expand fire detection tech after AI cameras spot 550 blazes

image.altText: Aryna Sabalenka kisses a trophy

props.synopsis: Aryna Sabalenka has won yet another title on Australian soil, showing that the Australian Open is hers for the taking.

title.children: Strength is Sabalenka's superpower, but variety will win her the AO

image.altText: A graphic of a female athlete throwing a javelin with a dollar sign on it

props.synopsis: Low pay, discrimination, disordered eating, sexism and online abuse are just a few of the prevalent issues ABC's Elite Athletes in Women's Sport Survey has revealed, despite recent progress in women's sport.

title.children: Elite sportswomen have shared their stories, and these are the hard truths

image.altText: Donald Trump speaking into a microphone while holding up his hand.

props.synopsis: The US is enforcing a strict oil blockade on Venezuela, the communist country's main supplier of oil, as the Trump administration continues to push Latin American countries to align with it.

title.children: Trump tells Cuba to 'make a deal' as US cuts off Venezuelan oil

image.altText: A politician with a stack of media papers walks into a media scrum on a street

props.synopsis: Independent MP Nick McBride, who is currently on home detention bail for the alleged assault of his wife, could receive around $100,000 in public funding to support his re-election campaign, according to the state's electoral commission.

title.children: Taxpayers could foot $100k bill for assault-accused MP's re-election bid

image.altText: People gathering at a big colourful music and food festival.

props.synopsis: A federal assistant minister and two Tasmanian state Labor MPs apologise after a complaint was made about their behaviour at the Taste of Summer festival in Hobart.

title.children: Labor MPs apologise over 'shoot, shag or marry' game at public festival

image.altText: boat washed onto rocks.

props.synopsis: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Koji has crossed the north Queensland coast between the towns of Ayr and Bowen and has weakened into a tropical low pressure system.

title.children: Intense rainfall follows ex-Tropical Cyclone Koji in sodden north Queensland

image.altText: a woman in gloves holds a large cane toad by its feet

props.synopsis: Holy giant toads, Batman! Will you ace this week's look back at the past?

title.children: History quiz: An EGOT, a giant toad and Sylvia Plath

image.altText: A close-up photo of a woman's face

props.synopsis: The Adelaide Festival board's decision to cancel the appearance of Palestinian-Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah from this year's Adelaide Writers' Week has prompted further fallout, with several board members and the chair stepping down.

title.children: Adelaide Festival board members, chair quit after author's cancellation from Writers' Week

image.altText: A close up photo of a white car with the word "police" written in blue over the bonnet and blue and white checks on the side.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating reports of an Islamic community leader being assaulted after he and his wife were forced off the road by a vehicle and racially abused in Dandenong South.

title.children: Muslim leader and wife allegedly abused, assaulted in Melbourne

image.altText: A close up photo of Peter Mandelson speaking.

props.synopsis: Peter Mandelson, who was fired as the UK's ambassador in Washington DC over his ties to the convicted sex offender, has apologised to victims of Jeffrey Epstein "for a system that refused to hear their voices".

title.children: Former UK diplomat says he did not know about Epstein abuse

image.altText: Daniil Medvedev clenches his fist

props.synopsis: Daniil Medvedev enjoys Australian Open warm up with first Brisbane International crown.

title.children: Relaxed Medvedev claims Brisbane International crown

image.altText: A female tennis player kisses her left arm.

props.synopsis: Aryna Sabalenka has claimed her second-straight Brisbane International title, beating Marta Kostyuk 6-4, 6-3.

title.children: Frosty finish as ice-cold Sabalenka soars to second-successive Brisbane title

image.altText: A young girl smiles with a Kelpie puppy on her lap.

props.synopsis: In small towns scattered around Australia, five kids have hit the jackpot. They've each been given a puppy from a champion muster dog.

title.children: Farm kids gifted champion's puppies to secure a skilled future

image.altText: the putside of the Fun2Learn childcare centre in rosehill

props.synopsis: Fun2Learn in Rosehill is the first centre to have its doors forcibly shut by the new child care regulator after it uncovered 41 breaches.

title.children: Sydney daycare first to be shut by new regulator over safety breaches

image.altText: President Donald Trump speaks during a news conference

props.synopsis: While debate rages over the legality and the potential fallout from America's incursion, there's been a quiet acceptance that it is all about oil.

title.children: Has Trump landed a dud with his Venezuelan oil play?

image.altText: Three young people stand together

props.synopsis: Survivors of a secretive Christian sect, under investigation by the FBI, say it is hiding wealth through trusts, blocking access to abuse compensation.

title.children: Christian sect investigated by the FBI under pressure to reveal wealth

image.altText: Eddie Scott stands at a lectern while speaking into a microphone.

props.synopsis: A man is charged with murder after six people from the same family were killed in a series of shootings.

title.children: Six dead, including child, in Mississippi shootings, suspect charged

image.altText: Eloise Worledge

props.synopsis: Fifty years after Beaumaris schoolgirl Eloise Worledge vanished, could new leads solve one of Australia's most haunting cold cases?

title.children: 'Only thing missing is my eight-year-old daughter': Father's chilling report

image.altText: Several people hold a large white banner while standing with a large group.

props.synopsis: The protests come after Renee Nicole Good was fatally shot by an immigration officer in Minneapolis.

title.children: Thousands protest against ICE after fatal shooting of Renee Nicole Good

image.altText: A racecar emits purple and blue smoke. It has no bonnet and the engine can be seen on display.

props.synopsis: Australia's largest car festival draws to a close in Canberra, with record cars, championship wins, and a brawl that police are investigating.

title.children: Brawl contained, fireworks cancelled due to fire ban as Summernats ends

image.altText: People and tents on Meelup beach

props.synopsis: As WA's tourist towns experience an influx of summer visitors, some locals are worried their hometowns could become too crowded unless visitor numbers are controlled.

title.children: WA towns look to tackle overtourism as 'crazy' crowds pack car parks, beaches

image.altText: A woman laying in bed wearing a blue medical suit.

props.synopsis: Women with lipoedema in the Northern Territory are struggling to access the care they need, forcing some to relocate for specialist treatment. The condition, often misunderstood, requires better medical support in regional Australia.

title.children: People with lipoedema face healthcare barriers, forcing some to relocate
